name: Kohuhu
climate: Kohuhu thrives in temperate climates where winters are mild and summers are moderate.
This plant can tolerate coastal climates, as it is resistant to salt spray and wind.
It grows well in regions where the climate is consistently humid and mild.
Kohuhu is adaptable but prefers climates without extreme temperature fluctuations.
sunlight: Kohuhu prefers full sunlight for most of the day to promote healthy foliage.
The plant can tolerate partial shade, though too much can affect its growth.
In hot climates, it benefits from some afternoon shade to prevent leaf scorch.
For optimal growth, ensure the plant gets at least six hours of sunlight daily.
watering: Kohuhu requires moderate watering, ensuring the soil does not dry out completely.
During dry spells, increase watering frequency to maintain adequate moisture.
It's important to allow the top layer of soil to dry slightly between waterings.
Overwatering should be avoided, as it can lead to root rot and other issues.
soil: A well-draining soil is essential to prevent water-logging and root damage.
Kohuhu thrives in fertile, loamy soil that is rich in organic matter and nutrients.
The plant can adapt to a range of soil types, from sandy soils to clay loam.
Ensure the soil is slightly acidic to neutral to promote optimal plant health.
